content.description:
Third Input starts just left of

Hole In One

. Difficult climbing past the 1st 3 bolts leads to a shelf, climb thru the bulge and join

Chaps My Hide

which is followed to the top.
content.protection:
5 independent bolts then 4 or 5 bolts on

Chaps My Hide

, chain anchor

content.description: Climb the face just left of Freakshow. Tricky layback crux at the 2nd bolt leads to 80' of easier fun climbing to the anchor.

This is a variation upper section between "

Hole In One

"  and "

Face To Face

". Climb the 1st 3 bolts of "

Hole In One

" , clip the 4th bolt(1st one on "

Face To Face

") and undercling up and left, standing on the hand traverse ledge on "

Hole In One

" . Continue up the Flake on underclings, head back out right in to a shallow undercling hueco, then straight up on crimpers(crux) to easier face climbing to the anchors.

"Name Unknown" listed as route # 907 in the Troy Mayr 3rd edition guide.

Located two routes to the immediate left of Freak Show.  (Freak Show is easily identifiable as it is protected using fixed chain draws.)

"Name Unknown" climbs using huecos up and right of a less than stellar pillar.  The rock can be crumbly, dirty and has less than inspiring holds that you'd prefer to not pull on but does have some varnished edges 1/3 of the way which are fun enough.

As you near the top of the crumbly pillar you will find closed shut anchors to the left. Even getting there seemed contrived.

There are much better routes on this crag.  Try this if you must, it's a warm up anyways.
content.location: Northern section of Fairway wall 2 routes right of "freak show".  Route line is obvious to follow and travels on the right side of a pillar before reaching the anchors (on the left of pillar).

content.description:
Nickel Slots starts just left of

Mojo Nation

and left of the dirty chimney. Start up the slab, traverse right thru the tricky Nickel Slots(crux)to easier climbing above and the anchors.

climbs.name: My China Girl
climbs.fa: Jack Marshall, Sam Owings, Melissa Chin

content.description:
This route starts to the right of

Creepy Hollow

. Follow the weakness up and slightly left, to the obvious crack/ flake, follow this to the anchor.

This good route is the furthest left route on the Fairway(out of view). It starts up around the corner, off a ledge, just right of the chimney. The crux is a tricky move right, near the third bolt. The top is easy, on beautiful brown patina.

Start up the obvious shallow weakness, in the middle of the wall, past 3 bolts, then hand traverse to the left on a shelf and up and left thru huecos to the lip of the roof. Turn the lip on thin holds and face climb for another 50' to the chain anchors.

Lean across from the boulder and pre clip the 1st draw. Start below, a hard boulder problem off the deck gets you started on this traversing route. Jugs, underclings, long reaches, side pulls, technical, tricky and pumpy. Unique route, local classic.
content.protection: 10 fixed chain draws, fixed chain draw anchor.
content.location: This route is the farthest right route and has fixed chain draws.

content.description:
Start up "

Hole In One

" for the first 3 bolts. (longer draw on the 3 bolt helps with rope drag) Then head up and right thru steep huecos, turn the lip on thin holds and face climb to the anchors.

This route starts to the right of

Hole In One

and it's variations. Follow a weakness up and slightly left to a large flake. Up and left to a exposed bulge, then back right under a roof(underclings). Reach out right to some friable flakes then straight up to the anchors. The features that you climb on give you the creeps and sound kinda hollow but are surprisingly solid. A mind f*** for sure.

Climb the blunt arete just right of

Mojo Nation

. Shallow huecos, side pulls, tricky to the slopping ledge. Turn the bulge with a long reach and face climb another 40' to the anchors.
